lexUnit.name: sincere.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: proceeding from or characterized by genuine feelings; free from pretence or deceit.

sentence.text: ` I thought he was sincere when he told me he wanted to stay in France .
Whatever the courtesy , the Profitboss is sincere about it .
` I 'm completely sincere about it , " he said .
They show that he was thoroughly sincere in his acceptance of collegiality .
It was felt that the government was not sincere in the implementation of community care because they mention community care in the same breath as cutbacks .
On the other hand , are they sincere in their praise ?
Let no one ever be sincere with me -- it is a failure of respect , and respect is a thing one can never get enough of .
Sir , -- May I offer my sincere thanks to the many voters who so successfully supported the candidacy of Gerald Malone in Alton , Holybourne , Chawton and Beech .
We have given our sincere apologies to both families for the distress and anxiety which we have caused them . "
Sincere thanks to all the walkers and especially to the many sponsors for their generosity , also to the support team .
Then came the blustering denials of any intention to act dishonestly , which did little to help their cause though many were sincere .
However , there is a future in the current unification process if everyone is sincere .
They are n't lying -- indeed , they 're all trying to be utterly sincere -- but they are n't telling the truth .
Since the meal had come entirely from tins , she could hardly believe he was being sincere , but she merely smiled and nodded her thanks .
She felt she ought to write Sarah a very simple and sincere and official letter of thanks for not being married .
His sincere and careful counselling was ineffective in introducing them to the life of the church .
It was n't her fault , she was sincere enough .
